name: hieroglyphic
content:

in or relating to a system of writing that uses pictures instead of words, especially as used in ancient Egypt: The funerary cones carry the names and titles of the tomb owner in hieroglyphic script. Hieroglyphic clay tablets were found here. Related words

[ C ] a picture or symbol that represents a word: We passed many doorways on either side, each marked with its descriptive hieroglyphic. He handed me a scrap of paper on which was scrawled a little sketch, or perhaps a hieroglyphic. Similar hieroglyphics have been found in southern Arizona. hieroglyphics [ plural ]
a system of writing that uses pictures instead of words, especially as used in ancient Egypt: He learned to write his name in hieroglyphics. For many centuries, nobody could read hieroglyphics. Compare
